CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper January 6, 1940, pg. 12, reads: "When the 'Hot Mikado' Bill 'Bojangles' Robinson came to town, Pittsburgh received him as a superb dancer, an unsurpassed entertainer, a 61-year-old man who has brought joyful tears to the eyes of millions of people. But Pittsburgh got more than the dancer, the entertainer, and the comedian. Shown here are some pictures of Bo as he identified himself with the civic and social life of the city, a veritable goodwill ambassador... 10. Three Little Maids, left to right: [illegible], Alice Harris, Yum-Yum; Pearl Harris...[illegible]...
TitMainTitle: Cast members of "The Hot Mikado" as "The Three Little Maids," including Alice Harris and Pearl Harris in costumes with headbands, surrounding kneeling man wearing dark vest, in dressing room of Nixon Theatre
